content.text: Orthopaedic Lab

Our Orthopaedic Lab is well-equipped with all the necessary facilities that will enhance student learning. Learning is instilled by performing simulation of various types of activities that play a vital role for everyday living for the client. Students also learn about Standardised Assessments and the empathetic gestures in handling patients. With the help of these standardised tools and scales the students will be able to identify the problems with their clients and will learn the art of training clients using various therapeutic methods which include balance training, gait training, prosthetic and orthotic training ADL skills training and other mobility skills as well.
Specifications

Mental Health Lab

content.text: Mental health Lab

In recent times, Mental Health has become a need of the hour. Mental health discipline has a special significance in the history of occupational therapy. Occupational Therapists with their clinical knowledge work on activity participation and skills needed for healthy functioning of the individuals with mental disturbances. This lab offers space for students to practice with guidance to build the necessary therapeutic skills and attitudes needed during psychosocial rehabilitation. Students have accessibility to practice the psychometric scales and assessment tools like MMSE, MOCA, Allen Cognitive Scale, etc. that are available in the lab. Occupational Therapy groups are often conducted in labs among students and faculties to enable understanding about group dynamics and process. Students also enact techniques like role play, psychodrama, motivational interviewing, etc. to enhancement their clinical practice skills.
Specifications

tags:
SRMIST & TAFE MoU signing ceremony 












  HomeSRMIST & TAFE MoU signing ceremony
















 










				On August 1st, 2024, a memorandum of understanding (MoU) was signed between the Department of Automobile Engineering of SRMIST, Kattankulathur and the Tractors and Farm Equipment (TAFE) Limited. The event was held at the Sivasailam Centre located at the TAFE facility at Sembiyam, Perambur, Chennai. This MoU is aimed to facilitate Graduate Engineers and Diploma holders from TAFE to pursue Master’s Program and Graduate program, respectively, offered by the department of Automobile Engineering. These candidates will be sponsored by TAFE. They will also have the scope of pursuing research in their chosen field. The other highlights include Internship opportunity to students, Plant visit by faculty and students, Faculty industry immersion program, knowledge sharing by inviting subject experts from both TAFE and SRMIST to deliver guest lecture / seminar / webinar / workshop / conferences etc., The agreement underscored a shared commitment between SRMIST and TAFE ultimately benefiting the TAFE employees, the student community and the faculty of SRMIST.

content.text: Vidya Lakshmi Portal for Education Loan

Vidya Lakshmi is a first of its kind portal for students seeking Education Loan. This portal has been developed under the guidance of Department of Financial Services, (Ministry of Finance), Department of Higher Education (Ministry of Human Resource Development) and Indian Banks Association (IBA).The portal has been developed and is maintained by NSDL e-Governance Infrastructure Limited. Students through this links, https://www.vidyalakshmi.co.in/, can view, apply and track the education loan applications to banks anytime, anywhere by accessing the portal. The portal also provides linkages to National Scholarship Portal.

content.text: Parents Feedback

Yesterday I received the Degree Certificate of my daughter, Juhi Anjali, B.Tech (Chemical)-2008, sent by your Office on my request. I was overwhelmed with your instant response and told my all colleagues about how fast and efficiently your institute is working. I applied only on 21.03.09 and in just four days i.e. on 25.03.09, I got it. I am amazed at the speed at which you responded and at the same time, I'm filled with pride and joy that my daughter graduated from your college.

Initially, I was a bit apprehensive about her future, when I got her admitted in your college. I had some initial doubts, as after all SRM is a private institute. But the way the faculty and all people associated with your college shape the future of students - I am proud to declare that I have got my daughter educated in one of the best institutions in the country.

She got a placement in T.C.S. in third year, where her friends from I.I.T. also got placed. Now I have no regrets that she could not study in I.I.T., as S.R.M. was as good as I.I.T., if not better. It really is!

At present she is in Manchester (England) with her husband. She is seeking admission in an advanced course in Manchester University. S.R.M. has imbibed in her a strong zeal to study further and to excel in whatever pursuit she is in. Thanks a lot.

content.text: About the College

Occupational Therapy is a healthcare profession that enables people of all ages to be independent in their day-to-day activities. SRM College of Occupational Therapy was started in the academic year 1996 under the Tamil Nadu Dr. M.G.R. Medical University. In the year 2004, the college was brought under the ambit of SRM University, and the same year Postgraduate program was started. SRM College is the only occupational therapy college to offer BOT, MOT, and PhD programs in Tamil Nadu. It is one of the colleges in South India which is recognized by the All India Occupational Therapists’ Association (AIOTA), the National Governing body of the profession and World Federation of Occupational Therapists (WFOT), the apex professional body worldwide, and accredited by NAAC with graded A++. These recognitions give a distinct advantage of being accepted at par in the world of medicine, which allows students to seek higher studies or employment in abroad.

Occupational Therapy in SRM is committed to guiding our students through a distinct learning process that allows the individual student to think, evaluate their own learning styles and experience learning through civic engagement in emerging practice areas and service-learning opportunities. We provide our students with exceptional opportunities to learn and grow as they transition from the classroom to successful careers in Occupational Therapy.

100% Job placement is guaranteed for students who graduate every year in BOT and MOT. 80% of our graduates are well placed in countries like USA, UK, Canada, Australia, Singapore, and Middle East. We have well-equipped clinical setup & research facilities. Tie up facilities for clinical training is being provided in major corporate hospitals such as SIMS Hospital, Vadapalani and other organizations such as NIEPMD at Muttukadu, Right Hospital, MDA – a special school for Dyslexia. Students of SRM College of Occupational Therapy have been placed in overseas for clinical placement at Latrobe University, Australia. Campus placement is done for USA & India through our SRM placement cell for major hospitals and companies. Community outreach program is carried out in villages in and around Kattankulathur where our faculty and students conduct Disability Survey and Health Education to provide Occupational Therapy intervention at doorstep.
College of Occupational Therapy

Welcome message

Welcome to the College of Occupational Therapy at SRM Institute of Science and Technology, Kattankulathur campus. The College of Occupational Therapy commenced in 1996, we have numerous achievements to rejoice. Our faculty is committed in educating future leaders, generating new knowledge, improving individuals health and well-being, and serving the greater community Locally, Nationally and Internationally. We also partner with prominent scientists and Healthcare professionals in India and around the world to shape the future of the profession in an everchanging Healthcare environment.
Our reputation and influence are growing through the outstanding scholarship and advocacy of our distinguished faculty and staff.

The faculty and staff of the College of Occupational Therapy mentor and inspire our students to think, care, create, and pursue justice in our world. We do this by preparing the next generation of leaders to practice innovative, evidence-based healthcare for our diverse global community. Our students are fully engaged throughout the learning process in their in-person and virtual classrooms, through interprofessional patient scenarios in our simulation facility, clinics and research labs, community outreach and advocacy.

We are dedicated in preparing students for contemporary healthcare practice, including an interprofessional, team-based approach to person-centered care. I hope you will explore our website to discover your future path in healthcare.
Programs Offered
B.O.T
Bachelor of Occupational Therapy trains students and helps them to become skilled professional occupational therapists, capable of undertaking independent/supervised practice.
M.O.T

The Master of Occupational Therapy provides students with skills and knowledge in treating clients who have difficulty participating in everyday life activities due to neurological, musculoskeletal or mental health issues.
PhD
Placement

Occupational Therapy profession provides a wide array of career options and avenues for specialization. We take great pride in the opportunities to secure placements in various countries such as the UK, Qatar, Dubai, Australia, New Zealand, and Canada. These achievements stand as a testament to the dedication and hard work of our graduates, showcasing their efforts in advancing the profession on a global scale. Our undergraduate alumni, were placed in the Jewel Autism Centre, Kerala and have also successfully secured positions in various hospitals and private therapy centers across India, with salaries averaging Rs. 6.6 lakhs per annum for BOT Graduates and Rs. 9 lakhs per annum for MOT Graduates.
We proudly would like to acclaim our recent accomplishment that in 2023, 15 of our PG students were placed in USA – Ed Theory, a top- ranked California-based company with a whopping salary package of 70,000 to 72,000 USD (approx. Rs. 58 lakhs per annum), 77 alumni are placed in UK under NHS Trust and more than 20 are placed in Middle East Countries. Furthermore, our alumni have exemplified exceptional initiative and drive by not only establishing entrepreneurial ventures across different states but also pursuing academic roles in various sectors. This dual representation truly highlights the multifaceted capabilities and achievements of our graduates.

Faculty

Teaching environment and quality are central to SRMIST’s capabilities profile. Our professors are the reason for our continued ability to foster vibrant and value-adding learning experiences for our students. The success of our students in terms of their learning and overall development enabled by our faculty members is an area of focus of leadership at SRMIST. Many opportunities are provided to our faculty members to conduct research and engage with the industry in consultancy and other projects. This platform brings our faculty members an opportunity to expand their knowledge contribution as well as bring those rich experiential inputs to the classrooms and labs therefore benefiting our students.

items: Home
Medicine & Health Sciences
SRM College of Occupational Therapy
SRM Autism Centre of Excellence (ACE)

content.text: Objectives
To provide all essential rehabilitation services under one roof for children with autism.
Autism Centre of Excellence
VISION

To deliver multidisciplinary, quality-centered care for individuals with Autism
To foster research in the field of autism to promote evidence based holistic care
To deliver multidisciplinary, quality-centered care for individuals with Autism
To foster research in the field of autism to promote evidence based holistic care
MISSION

To deliver comprehensive, holistic evaluation and interventions for individuals with Autism
To promote collaborative research and advocacy of parents and caregivers throughout the process to aid in better patient care
To deliver comprehensive, holistic evaluation and interventions for individuals with Autism
To promote collaborative research and advocacy of parents and caregivers throughout the process to aid in better patient care
Welcome message
Autism Centre of Excellence

SRM ACE is one of the first initiatives in a Medical College Hospital for children with autism. This centre was founded with the aim to provide all essential rehabilitation services including, occupational therapy, speech therapy, special education and psychology, all under one roof for children with autism. Through these services, SRM ACE will be promoting the inclusion of children with autism in mainstream schools and independence in the community. The services provided in SRM ACE are free of cost, thus making it easier for parents and community members to avail for the optimum services required for the child with autism.
Vision

items: To deliver multidisciplinary, quality-centered care for individuals with Autism
To foster research in the field of autism to promote evidence-based holistic care

content.text: Mission

items: To deliver comprehensive, holistic evaluation and interventions for individuals with Autism
To promote collaborative research and advocacy of parents and caregivers throughout the process to aid in better patient care

content.text: Special Features
SRM ACE is one of the first initiatives in a Medical College Hospital for children with autism in India.
Empower parents of children with autism for home program
Working towards community integration and inclusion in mainstream schooling.
The services provided in SRM ACE are free of cost, thus making it easier for parents and community members to avail the optimum services required for a child with autism.
Total number of Children with Autism: 276
On average, 70-80 individuals with autism receive services from SRM ACE on a daily basis

programs.title: SRM Faculty of Management, NSS, and Vidhaigal Thannarva Amaippu Organised an Awareness Rally on “Say No to Plastic” - SRMIST

content.text: SRM Faculty of Management, NSS, and Vidhaigal Thannarva Amaippu Organised an Awareness Rally on “Say No to Plastic”

items: Home
SRM Faculty of Management, NSS, and Vidhaigal Thannarva Amaippu Organised an Awareness Rally on “Say No to Plastic”

content.text: SRM Faculty of Management, SRMIST NSS, and Vidhaigal Thannarva Amaippu organised an awareness rally titled “Say No to Plastic” and a “Yellow Bag Distribution” initiative on February 10, 2025.

The rally commenced from the Faculty of Management building, proceeded through TP Ganesan Auditorium, and concluded at SRM Hospital. During the event, reusable yellow bags were distributed to visitors in the SRM Hospital area, promoting sustainable alternatives to plastic and encouraging eco-friendly practices.
Dr. Shivganesh Bhargava, Dean, Faculty of Management, SRMIST KTR and Dr. Krishnan A.R., Professor & BBA Chairperson, Faculty of Management, SRMIST KTR, graced the occasion.
Dr. K. Maheswari, NSS Programme Officer, SRMIST, Dr. V. Prakash, NSS Programme Coordinator, SRMIST, and Dr. T. Lakshmanan, NSS Programme Advisor, SRMIST, coordinated the initiative.
Seventy-five students enthusiastically participated in the event, actively contributing to raising awareness about plastic waste reduction and environmental sustainability.

By taking such a great initiative to raise awareness about plastic waste reduction and create an eco-friendly environment, the SRM community exhibits its commitment to maintaining a green environment and uplifting society.
Where could your journey at university take you?

content.text: Value Education Cell

The Value Education Cell at our university seeks to instil various initiatives to inspire and empower students and staffs to embrace universal human values, applying them in their personal and professional lives.

items: Home
Value Education Cell

content.text: Value Education Cell Overview

The Value Education Cell at our university seeks to instil various initiatives to inspire and empower students and staffs to embrace universal human values, applying them in their personal and professional lives. By incorporating value education into the academic experience our university aims to nurture individuals who can excel in their academic pursuits and also embody the essence of universal human values, to become ambassadors of holistic development in the global society. The activities of the cell include organizing FDPs, workshops, seminars, and conferences on regional, national and international levels related to human values and Holistic-Value-based Education and also facilitating discussions and awareness campaigns on issues of societal importance and encouraging community service and volunteering opportunities for students and faculty members

Universal Human Values are fundamental principles that are considered to be inherent and applicable to all human beings regardless of their cultural, religious, or geographical background. These values are based on existential realities & form the basis for ethical behaviour, social harmony, and the promotion of a just and equitable society. The Value Education Cell at our SRMIST was established on Aug 2022 to focus on incorporating value-based education into the university’s curriculum and campus culture.
Vision

The Vision of the Value Education Cell at the university is to create a nurturing and transformative learning environment through the process of self-exploration where students develop academical proficient and also imbued values with a deep sense of social responsibility. The cell envisions creating a campus community by producing graduates who are compassionate, empathetic, and committed to making a holistic transformation in society, upholding universal human values in all aspects of their lives.
Mission

The Mission of the Value Education Cell is to integrate value-based education seamlessly into the core fabric of the University’s Academic, co-curricular and administrative activities. The cell strives to foster an environment of relationship through personal transformation among students, faculty, and staff.
Dr. Supraja P
UHV - University Coordinator
uhv@srmist.edu.in
Welcome to Value Education Cell

Value education remains a significant need of the hour in today’s world. In the digital age, individuals navigate through this abundance of information and bombarded with information and get influenced easily. Technological advancements, medical breakthroughs, and social changes often create dilemmas. The fast-paced and competitive nature of modern life can lead to stress and mental health issues.

Education should help an individual to develop clarity on understanding (what to do?) & learning skills (how to do?) and practicing the understanding & skills will lead towards the fulfillment of human purpose.
As societies become more diverse, value education fosters inclusivity, respect for everyone and towards everything and promotes social cohesion and harmony.

Value education emphasizes the importance of self-regulation and equips individuals with the process of self-exploration it plays a crucial role in preventing social issues like violence, substance abuse, and discrimination and helps individuals to analyse and respond to these situations.
The value education helps

items: To develop the Right understanding of the self
To live with the feeling of a relationship with the human being leads to mutual happiness.
To live in a relationship with rest-of-nature leads to mutual prosperity.

content.text: The Value Education Cell at our university is to foster the holistic development of individuals by nurturing a strong foundation of values that will guide them throughout their lives. Over a period of time, such value-based education can contribute to the development of a humane society.

I invite all members of the university community to actively participate in the initiatives and activities of the Value Education Cell. Your contribution and commitment are vital in shaping the values-based learning environment we aspire to create. Let’s join hands to build a compassionate and socially responsible community and work together toward holistic development.
With warm regards,
Supraja

items: Core members
Coordinators
Outreach Programmes
Resources & Useful Links
Newsletter

content.text: Objectives

Promoting Universal Human Values: The primary objective is to promote and instil universal human values such as Co-existence, Harmony and feelings of relationship, prosperity, self-regulation, social responsibility and mutual fulfilment with rest of the nature among, faculty, and staff.

Curriculum Integration: Integrating value-based education modules into the university’s curriculum across various disciplines, ensuring that students are exposed to values considerations in their academic pursuits.
Solution centric approach: Providing guidance and training to students in making decisions for fulfilling life, equipping them to navigate complex situations with integrity.

Social Awareness and Empathy: Creating awareness about social issues and encouraging students to empathize with others’ experiences, leading to a deeper understanding of diverse perspectives and participate into societal transformation though foundational systems
Cultivating Responsible Citizenship: Instilling a sense of responsibility towards oneself, family, society and nature  and motivating them to actively contribute to just and equitable society.

Inclusivity and Diversity: Promoting an inclusive campus culture that embraces diversity, and promote intercultural understanding, fostering a sense of unity and harmony among the university community.
Leadership Development: Offering leadership development programs that emphasize the world-view, world-view, human values and through human conduct

Faculty Development: Offer training and development opportunities for faculty members to effectively impart value-based teachings in their classrooms and mentor students on  Understanding the concepts (proposal) through self-investigation.
Student Development: Organize workshops, seminars, and events that promote character development and human consciousness among students.
Community Engagement: Encouraging students to participate in community service, volunteering, and outreach activities to cultivate a sense of responsibility towards the society they live in.
Research and Advocacy: Conducting research on value education, ethics, and social issues, and advocating for the integration of universal human values in education and beyond.

Collaboration and Partnerships: Collaborating with other departments, student organizations, NGOs and external partners to create a holistic approach to leverage knowledge and resources for a broader impact

Assessment and Evaluation: Regularly assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of value education initiatives to continuously improve and refine the programs to meet the evolving needs of the university community.
Testimonials

I am truly grateful for the Universal Human Values workshop. It shifted my perspective on integrating these values into education. The practical application emphasis and insightful discussions were enlightening. I'm inspired to incorporate these values into my courses, reigniting my passion for education and holistic student growth. Excited to continue promoting universal human values. Thank you!

The Universal Human Values program transformed my life, fostering self-exploration and growth. It expanded my moral understanding, improved relationships, and provided essential tools for navigating challenges with compassion and purpose. Sharing these teachings empowered me and confirmed my commitment to growth as a compassionate, ethical, and self-aware individual.

The Universal Human Values program transformed me profoundly, sparking self-exploration and growth. It unveiled layers of self-awareness and enriched my moral compass, improving relationships and empowering me with tools for life challenges. Sharing these teachings with students has brought inner peace and clarity, fostered personal development and meaningful goal achievement while staying authentic. These values now guide my journey, shaping me into a compassionate, ethical, and self-aware individual, positively impacting the world.

The UHV course exceeded expectations, sparking transformative self-reflection and growth. Embracing universal principles, focusing on inner self, distinguishing self from body, and building trust enriched relationships. 
Revised perspective on love: selfless giving. These principles are now integral to daily life, influencing both personal and professional aspects. Regular reflections help me stay aligned. Grateful to UHV for lasting positive impact.

Universal Human Values (UHV) is a transformative compass for self-exploration and growth. It aligns intentions with competence, promoting harmony within and in the world. The concept of Natural Acceptance becomes clearer through UHV workshops, fostering positive changes in thoughts, behaviours, and relationships. Rooted in values like right understanding and natural acceptance, this ongoing journey equips for a more just and compassionate world. UHV empowers me to contribute meaningfully.

content.text: International Advisory Board

Back in 2003, SRM set up an International Advisory Board (IAB) consisting of 31 Distinguished Deans, Directors and professors from top universities across the world. SRM’s IAB is the first across the Indian University system. IAB works towards helping SRMIST set Global Standards and Internationalize through bringing globally acclaimed curriculum, research and teaching methodology to its students and faculty members.

Now over 50+ Members are on IAB and they are from the best of the universities across the world including Harvard Business School, Kennedy Public School (Harvard University), MIT, Stanford, LSE, UC Berkeley, Cambridge, NUS among others.

content.text: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)

SRMIST is committed to fostering global partnerships that enhance educational, research, and cultural exchange. Our Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) with leading universities, research institutions, and industry partners worldwide reflect this commitment. These strategic alliances enable us to offer our students and faculty unparalleled opportunities for growth, innovation, and collaboration.

items: Home
SRMIST Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)

content.text: About

The Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) at SRM Institute of Science and Technology (SRMIST) plays a pivotal role in shaping our global and national collaborations. These strategic partnerships with leading academic institutions, research centers, and industry giants enable SRMIST to elevate its educational and research endeavors.

Through a network of MoUs that stretches across the globe, SRMIST ensures that our students and faculty are integrated into an international academic community. These partnerships provide invaluable opportunities for global exposure, cross-cultural experiences, and access to cutting-edge resources and expertise, enriching the university’s academic and research landscape.
Strategic Collaborations
SRMIST’s MoUs are designed to foster mutually beneficial relationships that contribute to academic growth, research advancements, and societal impact. These collaborations enable us to:
Expand Academic Opportunities
Joint degree programs, student and faculty exchanges, and specialized training courses to provide a global academic perspective.
Enhance Research Capabilities
Collaborative research projects that push the boundaries of knowledge, leading to groundbreaking discoveries.
Facilitate Industry Engagement
Partnerships with industry leaders to offer hands-on experience, internships, and real-world problem-solving opportunities.
Promote Innovation
Encouraging innovation through joint ventures in technology development, intellectual property, and entrepreneurship initiatives.

programs.title: SRMIST’s 16th annual cultural extravaganza Milan’ 2024 brings together popular artists to regale students - SRMIST

content.text: SRMIST’s 16th annual cultural extravaganza Milan’ 2024 brings together popular artists to regale students

items: Home
SRMIST’s 16th annual cultural extravaganza Milan’ 2024 brings together popular artists to regale students

content.text: Milan 2024, the 16th annual students’ cultural festival of SRM Institute of Science and Technology, will begin tomorrow and feature live performances of some of the most popular artists, in addition to more than 150 student events, with a total prize amount of Rs. 12 lakhs up for grabs.

The four-day cultural extravaganza will begin on Thursday, said Vice Chancellor, SRM IST, Prof. C.Muthamizhchelvan at a media interaction. He said that while Aarush was the annual student technical festival, Milan was the institution’s annual students’ cultural festival. Milan was a team effort of the students, planned and organised by them belonging to various clubs and coordination committees. Such events, he said, would contribute to building team spirit, foster team work and inculcate leadership skills in students, Prof. Muthamizhchelvan added.

Students belonging to events, publicity, sponsorship, and discipline among other committees said Milan’s theme this year was ‘Streets’ – a tribute to various countries’ street life and culture. The creative team of the institution contributed extensively to re-creating the concept of street life in different countries. For instance, students had adorned the pathway from the main arch till Raja Raja Chozhan Statue with Chinese lanterns. Similarly, Madhubani paintings made by Nepalese students were also installed in a stretch, while Bommalaattam – a traditional art of Tamil Nadu also found a place.
Andrea Jeremiah, Pradeep Kumar, Neeti Mohan to perform:

Popular actor and singer Andrea Jeremiah, and singer Pradeep Kumar will perform on Thursday, while DJ shows by Ravator, and techno music by Third Party will be the highlights on Friday. There will be no live pro shows on the third day (Saturday), and on the concluding day on Sunday, there will be performances by Vaisagh and Rakhoo, Ahmed Meeran, in addition to a live performance by Neeti Mohan, noted playback singer.

The student organizers said they had been planning for several months while preparing for the annual cultural festival. They expected over 50,000 students from about 150 colleges all over India to take part in Milan 2024, including online events. In addition to various events being organized by the different clubs – Sports, Dance, Literary, Rotaract, Music, Dramatics, Fashion, Creative Arts, Gaming and Fun Games, among many others, Milan 2024 will also see events dedicated to women’s empowerment, a science conference, events to highlight cultural and social diversity, apart from a blood donation camp.

The students said that immediately after Milan 2024, they would also host Butterflies, where the students would engage with students of primary classes in government schools in the region. A comprehensive health check-up camp and awareness programmes will form part of Butterflies.
Registrar, Dr. S.Ponnusamy, Associate Director, of Student Affairs, Dr. Nisha Ashokan, and Deputy Director, of Student Affairs, SRM IST, Dr. Prince Kalyanasundaram were also present.
Milan Day 1
The melange of events at SRMIST Milan 2024 brings youth from all over India closer Andrea, and Pradeep Kumar’s performances have an audience on their feet.

Milan 2024 – the 16th annual cultural students’ festival of SRM Institute of Science and Technology, and one of the most sought-after pan-India events began on Thursday evening with a spectacular live performance by popular artists in addition to events hosted by various clubs of the institution.
Street life from the world over:

For students from all over India who had reached the sprawling and verdant campus of SRM IST to compete and perform at Milan 2024, it was a refreshing welcome and experience. With the theme of Milan 2024 being ‘Streets’ – a fitting tribute the vibrant culture of street life of countries from all over the world, the visiting students were awe-struck at the grandeur and creativity of the host institution.

Kicking off the proceedings was the event at Mini Hall – where the music of the contestants serenaded the gathering and judges alike. With superlative performances from all participants, it was a close call for the jury to spot the winners – J Sushmitha and J Sushma of Kalasilingam University. A stone’s throw away from here at the Management Block – it was a fusion of beats, loops, and rhythm at the ‘Beatbox Revolution’ event. The performers with their innovative, creative talent captivated the audience and in the end, Venkat Sri and Lathesh bagged the top honours.

In total contrast was ‘Turncoat’ at Law Block, with five eloquent speakers speaking on diverse topics and with the audience open to contrasting views, it was a battle of wits resulting in Seshadri, Abhishek, and Santhosh HP securing the top prizes.

At Faraday Hall, the audience was in splits at the Standup Comedy event judged by Rishi. Students delivered a no-holds-barred presentation, leaving the audience in splits. Other events on the inaugural day that were hugely popular with the students including Potpourri, Comic Scripts, Urban Couture Unveiled – fashion show, Nrityanjali – an electrifying solo classical dance that saw an overwhelming participation from over 50 contestants. Mahalaskshmi R of Ethiraj College for Women bagged the first prize for her performance.
Andrea, Pradeep steal the show:

Just as the day ended, students warmed up to each other and assembled at the venue for the moment they were waiting for – live performances by actor and singer, Andrea Jeremiah, and singer Pradeep Kumar.

Andrea Jeremiah crooned some of her most popular numbers as well as cover versions and her swag was a spontaneous hit among the audience. She has to her credit some of the most popular songs and her live performance of the songs had the audience on a non-stop groove mode.

Just when the audience thought that the best was over, Pradeep Kumar – the voice behind some of the most popular numbers took over the stage and rocked. The crowd could not have asked for better with two of the most popular, versatile singers performing back-to-back. The first day events left the students asking for more and were impressed with the themes, events, and pro-shows by most popular artistes at Milan 2024, proving once again why SRM IST is the premier destination not just for higher learning, but also for youth to come together and build teamwork, and partake the best of each other’s culture.

Registrar, Dr. S.Ponnusamy and Associate Director, of Student Affairs, Dr. Nisha Ashokan, and Deputy Director, of Student Affairs, SRMIST, Dr. Prince Kalyanasundaram were also present on the ocassion.

SRMIST’s 16th annual cultural extravaganza Milan’ 2024 brings together popular artists to regale students 












  HomeSRMIST’s 16th annual cultural extravaganza Milan’ 2024 brings together popular artists to regale students
















 










 Milan 2024, the 16th annual students’ cultural festival of SRM Institute of Science and Technology, will begin tomorrow and feature live performances of some of the most popular artists, in addition to more than 150 student events, with a total prize amount of Rs. 12 lakhs up for grabs.The four-day cultural extravaganza will begin on Thursday, said Vice Chancellor, SRM IST, Prof. C.Muthamizhchelvan at a media interaction. He said that while Aarush was the annual student technical festival, Milan was the institution’s annual students’ cultural festival. Milan was a team effort of the students, planned and organised by them belonging to various clubs and coordination committees. Such events, he said, would contribute to building team spirit, foster team work and inculcate leadership skills in students, Prof. Muthamizhchelvan added.Students belonging to events, publicity, sponsorship, and discipline among other committees said Milan’s theme this year was ‘Streets’ – a tribute to various countries’ street life and culture. The creative team of the institution contributed extensively to re-creating the concept of street life in different countries. For instance, students had adorned the pathway from the main arch till Raja Raja Chozhan Statue with Chinese lanterns. Similarly, Madhubani paintings made by Nepalese students were also installed in a stretch, while Bommalaattam – a traditional art of Tamil Nadu also found a place.Andrea Jeremiah, Pradeep Kumar, Neeti Mohan to perform:Popular actor and singer Andrea Jeremiah, and singer Pradeep Kumar will perform on Thursday, while DJ shows by Ravator, and techno music by Third Party will be the highlights on Friday. There will be no live pro shows on the third day (Saturday), and on the concluding day on Sunday, there will be performances by Vaisagh and Rakhoo, Ahmed Meeran, in addition to a live performance by Neeti Mohan, noted playback singer.The student organizers said they had been planning for several months while preparing for the annual cultural festival. They expected over 50,000 students from about 150 colleges all over India to take part in Milan 2024, including online events. In addition to various events being organized by the different clubs – Sports, Dance, Literary, Rotaract, Music, Dramatics, Fashion, Creative Arts, Gaming and Fun Games, among many others, Milan 2024 will also see events dedicated to women’s empowerment, a science conference, events to highlight cultural and social diversity, apart from a blood donation camp.The students said that immediately after Milan 2024, they would also host Butterflies, where the students would engage with students of primary classes in government schools in the region. A comprehensive health check-up camp and awareness programmes will form part of Butterflies.Registrar, Dr. S.Ponnusamy, Associate Director, of Student Affairs, Dr. Nisha Ashokan, and Deputy Director, of Student Affairs, SRM IST, Dr. Prince Kalyanasundaram were also present. 



Milan Day 1 



The melange of events at SRMIST Milan 2024 brings youth from all over India closer Andrea, and Pradeep Kumar’s performances have an audience on their feet.Milan 2024 – the 16th annual cultural students’ festival of SRM Institute of Science and Technology, and one of the most sought-after pan-India events began on Thursday evening with a spectacular live performance by popular artists in addition to events hosted by various clubs of the institution.Street life from the world over:For students from all over India who had reached the sprawling and verdant campus of SRM IST to compete and perform at Milan 2024, it was a refreshing welcome and experience. With the theme of Milan 2024 being ‘Streets’ – a fitting tribute the vibrant culture of street life of countries from all over the world, the visiting students were awe-struck at the grandeur and creativity of the host institution.Kicking off the proceedings was the event at Mini Hall – where the music of the contestants serenaded the gathering and judges alike. With superlative performances from all participants, it was a close call for the jury to spot the winners – J Sushmitha and J Sushma of Kalasilingam University. A stone’s throw away from here at the Management Block – it was a fusion of beats, loops, and rhythm at the ‘Beatbox Revolution’ event. The performers with their innovative, creative talent captivated the audience and in the end, Venkat Sri and Lathesh bagged the top honours.In total contrast was ‘Turncoat’ at Law Block, with five eloquent speakers speaking on diverse topics and with the audience open to contrasting views, it was a battle of wits resulting in Seshadri, Abhishek, and Santhosh HP securing the top prizes.At Faraday Hall, the audience was in splits at the Standup Comedy event judged by Rishi. Students delivered a no-holds-barred presentation, leaving the audience in splits. Other events on the inaugural day that were hugely popular with the students including Potpourri, Comic Scripts, Urban Couture Unveiled – fashion show, Nrityanjali – an electrifying solo classical dance that saw an overwhelming participation from over 50 contestants. Mahalaskshmi R of Ethiraj College for Women bagged the first prize for her performance.Andrea, Pradeep steal the show:Just as the day ended, students warmed up to each other and assembled at the venue for the moment they were waiting for – live performances by actor and singer, Andrea Jeremiah, and singer Pradeep Kumar.Andrea Jeremiah crooned some of her most popular numbers as well as cover versions and her swag was a spontaneous hit among the audience. She has to her credit some of the most popular songs and her live performance of the songs had the audience on a non-stop groove mode.Just when the audience thought that the best was over, Pradeep Kumar – the voice behind some of the most popular numbers took over the stage and rocked. The crowd could not have asked for better with two of the most popular, versatile singers performing back-to-back. The first day events left the students asking for more and were impressed with the themes, events, and pro-shows by most popular artistes at Milan 2024, proving once again why SRM IST is the premier destination not just for higher learning, but also for youth to come together and build teamwork, and partake the best of each other’s culture.Registrar, Dr. S.Ponnusamy and Associate Director, of Student Affairs, Dr. Nisha Ashokan, and Deputy Director, of Student Affairs, SRMIST, Dr. Prince Kalyanasundaram were also present on the ocassion.

content.text: Tamil Perayam Awards 2024

items: Home
Tamil Perayam Awards 2024

content.text: Tamil Perayam in SRM Institute of Science and Technology, has been awarding the Tamil Peraya Awards every year since 2012. The categories include Best Tamil Books, Best Tamil Magazine, Best Tamil Society, and Best Tamil Scholars respectively.

SRM Institute of Science and Technology (SRMIST) is organizing the Tamil Perayam Awards 2024. The annual recognition program honors individuals who have made significant contributions to the Tamil language and literature.
Award Categories:
Best books

items: Pudumaipitthan Padaippilakkiya Award (Short Story, Novel, Drama)
Bharathiyar Kavidhai Award (Poetry)
Aazha. Valliappa Kuzhanthai Ilakkiya Award (Children’s Literature)
G.U. Pope Mozhipeyarpu Award (Literary Translation)
Abdul Kalam Ilam Thamizh Aaivaringnar- Valar Tamizh Award (Research Book on Language, Literature & History)
Muthuthandavar Tamilisai Award ( For a book on Tamil music)
Paridhimar Kalaignar Award (For their exceptional research and scholarship that have deepened our understanding of Tamil language and literature)
Muthamizh Arignar Kalaignar Karunanidhi Social Justice Award (For their work in promoting social justice and equality, using Tamil as a powerful tool for social change)

content.text: Best Tamil Magazine / Paper
9.Suthesamithiran Tamizh Ithal Award (Tamil Art, Literary Culture Magazine/Paper)
Best Tamil Organization
10. Tholkappiar Tamizh Sangam Award (for one organization only)
Best Art Group
11. Arunachala Kavirayar Award (Tamil Music Group / Folk Art Group)
A Great Tamil Scholar
12. Parivendar Payintamil Award (Tamil Scholar-Lifetime Achievement)

SRMIST feels proud to announce the “Tamil Perayam Awards” recognizing the talented individuals who have enriched the world through their work in Tamil. The final day for receiving nominations is May 31st, 2024.
The official award ceremony will be held later this year, where the awardees will be felicitated for their achievements.
This year’s SRM Tamil Perayam Awards ceremony promises to be a grand celebration of the Tamil language and its vibrant literary heritage.
Contact

items: Head, Tamil Perayam, First floor SRMIST, Kattankulathur - 603 203
tamilperayam@srmist.edu.in

programs.title: SRMIST kattankulathur and Veranda XL Partners with to Offer CA Training on Campus - SRMIST

content.text: SRMIST kattankulathur and  Veranda XL Partners with to Offer CA Training on Campus

items: Home
SRMIST kattankulathur and  Veranda XL Partners with to Offer CA Training on Campus

content.text: Chennai, December 17, 2024 – Veranda XL, a division of Veranda Learning Solutions, has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with SRM Institute of Science and Technology (SRMIST), Kattankulathur, Tamil Nadu, to offer Chartered Accountancy (CA) training on the SRM campus. This collaboration will provide SRM students with specialized CA training under the esteemed banner of JK Shah Classes (JKSC), one of India’s leading CA coaching institutes.

The partnership aims to combine JKSC’s four-decade-long expertise in CA education with SRMIST’s academic strength to offer a comprehensive and rigorous curriculum. The program will provide end-to-end CA training, covering all levels of the CA course, and will be delivered by expert faculty using innovative teaching methods. With a proven track record of success, this collaboration is designed to equip students with the skills, knowledge, and confidence needed to excel in accounting, auditing, and finance.

Dr. A. Duraisamy, Dean of the Faculty of Science and Humanities at SRMIST, expressed his excitement about the collaboration, stating, “Our partnership with JK Shah Classes is a game-changer for students aspiring to become Chartered Accountants. Bringing JKSC’s renowned expertise to our campus will provide our students with unparalleled academic guidance and practical learning, ensuring they are prepared to meet global industry standards.”

JK Shah Classes, renowned for its outstanding contribution to CA education, trains over 70,000 students annually and has produced more than 1,800 CA rankers since its inception in 2001. Mr. Vishal Shah, Chief Operating Officer of JK Shah Classes, highlighted the significance of the partnership, stating, “We are thrilled to collaborate with SRM Institute of Science and Technology to offer high-quality CA training. At JKSC, we are committed to nurturing the next generation of accounting professionals through a robust curriculum, experienced faculty, and proven teaching methodologies. This partnership reaffirms our mission to equip students with the knowledge and skills needed to succeed in the competitive finance and accounting sectors.”
About Veranda Learning Solutions:

Founded in 2018 by the Kalpathi AGS Group, Veranda Learning Solutions Limited has quickly emerged as a prominent player in the Indian education space. The company offers a range of educational services including school and college coaching, test preparation, study abroad programs, and software upskilling. With a strong nationwide presence, Veranda integrates advanced technology and innovative methodologies to deliver high-quality, personalized learning experiences. Veranda’s mission is to drive student success and academic excellence through a disciplined and comprehensive learning framework.

The MoU was signed in the presence of esteemed representatives from both institutions at the SRM IST campus. Dr. S. Ponnusamy, Registrar of SRMIST, and Dr. A. Vinay Kumar, Pro Vice Chancellor (SBL), along with Dr. A. Duraisamy, Dean of the Faculty of Science and Humanities (FSH),  Dr. S. Albert Antony Raj, Deputy Dean and Mr.G.Sivakumar – Vice President Veranda Learning Solutions Ltd  were present at the signing ceremony.
Where could your journey at university take you?

programs.title: Research and Development Cell | Research - SRMIST

content.text: Research and Development Cell

items: Home
Research
Research and Development Cell

content.text: Research & Development Cell
The National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 envisages the promotion of quality research within the Higher Education system.

The integration of Research, Innovation and Technology Development is the foundation of Atma-Nirbhar Bharat (Self-reliant India). The establishment of Research and Development Cell (RDC) in Higher Education Institutes will enable attainment of targets of Atma-Nirbhar Bharat and is expected to play a pivotal role in catalyzing multidisciplinary/ transdisciplinary and translational research culture mandated in NEP 2020.
Vision, Mission & Objectives
Vision
To put in place a robust mechanism for developing and strengthening the research ecosystem within HEIs, aligned with the provisions of NEP-2020.
Mission

items: To create a conducive environment for enhanced research productivity.
To encourage collaboration across industry, government, community- based organizations, and agencies at the local, national, and international levels.
To facilitate greater access to research through mobilization of resources and funding.

content.text: Objectives

items: To create an organizational structure with role-based functions of RDC, formulate Research Policy for the HEIs, identify thrust areas of research, and form related cluster groups/ frontline teams/consortia of researchers.

To create enabling provisions in Research Policies for recruitment of research personnel, procurement of equipment, and financial management with adequate autonomy to the Principal Investigator(s) and disseminate research outcomes to stakeholders and the public at large.

To establish a special purpose vehicle to promote researchers and innovators, identify potential collaborators from industry, research organizations, academic institutions & other stakeholders for cooperation and synergistic partnerships.

To act as a liaison between researchers & relevant research funding agencies, extend guidance in preparation & submission of project proposals and post-sanctioning of the grants to oversee adherence to timelines.
To have better coordination among other cells/centers dealing with University-Industry Inter Linkage, Incubation, Innovation and Entrepreneurship Development and Intellectual Property Rights (IPR).

To develop an Institutional Research Information System for sharing the status of ongoing/ completed research projects/Programmes, expertise & resources, etc., making effective use of Information & Communication Technology (ICT) for preparing the database of in-house experts to provide industrial consultancy and services.
To engage & utilize the services of superannuated active faculty/scientists in research capacity building of talented young minds and promote mobility of researchers across institutions and R&D Labs.

To serve as nodal center for ideation and conceptualization of research topics/themes by organizing workshops and training programs and ensuring the integrity and ethical practices in research activities including clearance of bioethical committee wherever required.

content.text: Committee Members

items: M. Vairamani, Dean, SBE (consultant) -Chairman
V. Thirumurugan, Associate Director (CL)
V. Ramanujam, Asst. Registrar (Accounts)/ Consultant
C. Lavanya, Manager (Accounts)
A. Latha, Superintendent (Accounts – office)
One Technical staff

content.text: Roles of the committee members:
Finance:

items: RDC can facilitate resource mobilization and create a Corpus for research and development from government, industry, and other funding agencies and channelize Corporate Social 9 Responsibility (CSR) funds for sustenance and furtherance of research activities.

Apart from creating a Corpus fund exclusively for R&D, RDC can explore venture capitalists and angel investors for funding in research and innovation. It needs to liaise with funding agencies, and track funding opportunities from industrial consortia.
The HEI may make provision for research in the annual budget subject to the availability of funds.
The corpus created for research could also support the seed funding for freshly recruited faculty for developing research facilities, publications, and patenting.
D. John Thiruvadigal, Dean (Sciences) – Chairman
Dean, Research (Ramapuram)
Deans (CET, S & H, Management and Medical)
Dean, Research (Medical), KTR
Dean, Mechanical
Dean, Pharmacy
N. Selvamurugan, Research Prof., Dept. of Biotech.
E. Senthil Kumar, Research Asso. Prof., Dept. of Physics
Jesu Arokiaraj, Research Prof., (S and H)
One Technical staff

content.text: Roles of the committee members:
Research Guidance from RDC will aim to encourage faculties to conceive ideas through enhanced industry-academia interactions and prepare research proposals for funding from various agencies.

Organizing events like capacity-building programs (Research 8 Methodology and Research Techniques) and specific research theme-based workshops and Research Internships will motivate the end-users (students, scholars, and faculties) to participate actively in the process of ideation and innovative research in emerging areas.
Research Thrust and Clustered Areas

items: Thrust areas for Research in an HEI should be identified, underpinning the societal needs and the availability of key resources, including in-house human resources, faculty research competencies, and support systems. This would enable HEI to consider establishing a Center of Excellence (CoE) in these identified contemporary areas of research.

Research Clusters and/or Regional Research Consortia prompted/formed by RDC to bring all researchers, faculty, students, scholars, and Post-Doctoral Fellows for joint high value (interdisciplinary and trans-disciplinary) research projects to avail national and international funding opportunities. Shared infrastructure and expertise will enable crossfertilization of ideas and mobilization of resources.
Further, forming Regional Research Consortia adds a synergistic advantage in finding solutions in inter-disciplinary, transdisciplinary, and multidisciplinary areas.

CoEs’ can serve as Incubation Centres to transform innovative ideas into processes and products administered and monitored by the proposed RDC. RDC could also provide an avenue for community talent with prior learning/expertise to engage in research and innovation activities of HEI.

content.text: Research Incentives and Recognition

items: Incentives play a significant role in triggering and catalyzing research interest among scholars and faculties. Incentivizing quality publications and patents by students and faculty will have an enduring positive impact.

Institution of Excellence Awards for accomplishments/achievements in the form of impactful quality research and/ or research-based teaching will further stimulate and invigorate the research and innovation activities of the HEI.
RDC should also develop a policy focussing on identifying specific incentives for research faculty and develop a unique Research Career ladder for strengthening the mission “Research”.

content.text: Capacity Building

items: RDC would play a crucial role in building the capacity of faculty and students to undertake research problems in line with the latest advances in diverse disciplines to push the boundaries of knowledge through publications and contribute to technological developments relevant to societal needs.

It would also pave the way for HEI to attract more research grants under norm-based funding, improve its accreditation ranking and enhance its brand image. Regular events such as refresher courses, workshops, trainings/internships, group discussions and seminars/conferences may be organized for capacity building.
RDC would play a pivotal role in creating central R&D facilities with the provisioning of associated training/internship thereon.
Revathi Venkataraman (Chairperson, SoC) –Chairman
Kartar Singh, Director, International Relations
Paromita Chakraborty, Research Asso. Professor
M. Navaneethan, Research Asst. Prof. Dept. of physics
Baskara Sethupathi, Asst. Prof., Dept. of Automobile
One Technical staff

content.text: Roles of the committee members:

items: A vibrant research ecosystem in HEI aims to provide meaningful thrust for sustainable research and innovation and promote collaboration between government, universities, research institutes and industries.
HEIs need to build a sustainable research ecosystem that leads to consistent quality research outcomes and enhanced productivity.

In order to make RDC functionality viable, the HEIs that are relatively new or not so well established should develop a connection with RDCs of already well-known/established HEIs for their research. RDC in each HEI will act as a facilitator for networking and collaborative research with other national and international institutions working in inter- disciplinary, trans-disciplinary, and multidisciplinary research areas.

Reformed administrative structure at HEIs can reach out to key industry players, research organizations, institutions, associations, NGOs, government bodies to forge strategic partnerships. HEIs need to establish collaborations, teams/consortia, partnerships, and combined ventures for joint research activities through clustering institutions and organizations to facilitate the exchange of students, scholars, and faculty.
There is a need to strengthen resource sharing in content and infrastructure both within the university and among universities, funding agencies, industries, corporates and government.
K. Vijayakumar, HOD, EEE–Chairman
R. Ananthakumar, SIDC
R.C. Sathish Kumar, Coordinator, IIISM
M. Jawaharlal, Dean, Agriculture
HODs (Mech., EEE., Auto, Chemistry, Physics)
HOD, Mechatronics
HOD, Aerospace
C. Bharatiraja, Professor, Dept. of EEE
P. Malar, Research Professor, Dept. of Physics
K. Ananthanarayanan, Research Asso. Prof., Dept. of Chemistry
J. Archana, Research Asso. Prof., Dept. of Physics
Scientific Officers (2 nos.)

content.text: Roles of the committee members:
Research Monitoring

items: The current policy environment in India encourages HEIs to be responsible and accountable for research development and innovation activities through the creation of infrastructure, generation of resources, promotion of business, and facilitation of policy framework to nurture the culture of quality research by adhering to ethical practices.

Among the standard functions, the RDC in an HEI needs to monitor and oversee research progress, coordinate program, manage and facilitate optimizing resources, timely review of research activities for completion of the projects as per schedule.
HEIs need to formulate and adhere to specific quality benchmarks for research to meet the global/ international standards.

The proposed RDC should conduct a quality review (SWOC Analysis) or internal evaluation of the research papers and suggest Scopus Indexed, Web of Science (WoS), or UGC-CARE recognized journals for appropriate publications.

R & D Cell of HEIs must ensure that all the Research Labs in the institution fulfill the norms of Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) and Safety (Bio and Chemical) measures, recognized as QIP center and by the National Accreditation Board of Laboratories (NABL).

content.text: Technology Development and Business Centred Facility

items: The Technology Development and business-centered facility will be a hub for strategic partnerships/ collaborations, industry-institute interface, sponsored or contract research, new knowledge generation, IPR, and patent services, venture capital, trade/market portfolio, technology transfer, and commercialization of research to facilitate innovation, incubation, entrepreneurship and start-up ventures.
Santhanu Patil, Medical – Chairman
Gurudath, Dean, Law
K.C. Ravishankar, Law Officer
W. Manivannan, Dy. Registrar
Melvin George (Medical)
Dean (Dental), KTR
One technical staff

content.text: Roles of the committee members:
Integrity and Ethics

items: Regular initiatives by RDC will ensure that researchers understand the importance of integrity and ethics and comply with ethical codes of research and publishing practices at institutional, national, and global levels.

A standard plagiarism check should be mandatorily implemented and the requisite software in this regard made accessible to all researchers. In addition, the RDC will sensitize the research community about dubious research and publishing practices and predatory journals.
B. Neppolian, Dean (Research) – Chairman
Bhagavandas Head, Centre for Statistics
P. Rajendran, Librarian
One Technical Staff

content.text: Roles of the committee members:
Information Management System

items: HEIs play a key role in the advancement of research and innovation as two distinct entities through Research Information Management System (RIMS) for the benefit of faculty, students, industry and other stakeholders.

HEIs should put in place a RIMS to collect and manage research-oriented information, databases, publications, research projects, fellowships, collaborations, patents, thrust areas, innovations etc. aligned with the institution’s research policies.

RIMS would also provide a platform for accessing resource-centric information pertaining to human capital (Expertise), physical capital (State- of-Art Research Laboratories and Sophisticated Instrumentation Facility), and knowledge capital (Digital Library & Information, Intellectual Property Facilitation, Quantitative Methods & Data Analysis, Analytical and Consultancy Services).

As per the requirements of various regulatory agencies, researchers can submit, modify, or update their research compliances such as protocol approval, training records, equipment lists, etc. RIMS can provide a centralized and integrated database to manage issues related to and radioactive-safety approval clearances for use and disposal of biological, chemical and radioactive hazardous materials, protective equipment measures, surveillance of staff, appropriate trainings/workshops, etc.

Each HEI needs to create a blog or portal for Institutional Research Information and Institutional Repository and sign an MoU with UGC- INFLIBNET to access and upload the research information through Shodh Ganga, Shodh Gangotri, Shodh Sindhu, Shodh Shuddhi, and Shodh Chakra.

The Innovation Management (ISO 56002:2019) can be implemented as a common framework to develop and deploy innovation capabilities, evaluate performance, and achieve intended outcomes of global standards.

content.text: Prof. A. Vinay Kumar  Pro Vice-Chancellor (FSH, Management, LAW)

With 25 years of excellence in academics and administration, Prof. A. Vinay Kumar onboards as the Pro Vice Chancellor of Faculty of Science and Humanities, School of Law and School of Management, SRM IST bringing a visionary approach to the forefront. Prof. A. Vinay Kumar’s remarkable list of accomplishments in academics, research, administration and development initiatives has consistently demonstrated his vision and expertise. From being associated with IIM, Lucknow as a Professor of Finance involved in teaching and administration, to holding the position, Director at NMIMS University, Bengaluru, and changing the dynamics of the place, he has achieved several prominent milestones. In his promising career, he has been a part of several successful missions involving curriculum reappraisal, course designs, launching diploma and executive training programs, chairing prominent committees, research initiatives, handling accreditation processes and the list goes on. During his visionary leadership, NMIMS had consistently ranked in the India Today’s Top 20 Institutes for 2 years. His ardent search of knowledge, dedication towards learning and enthusiastic approach makes him an eminent personality. SRM IST looks forward to a new chapter under Prof. A. Vinay Kumar’s leadership, marked by innovation, and a commitment to achieving its mission and goals.

content.text: Dr. Ravi Pachamuthu Pro-Chancellor (Administration)

Education is not only the key to opening resources for growth but also the exploration of self that lead to the discovery of potentials. On the whole, the education sector has witnessed a paradigm shift. The erstwhile focus has shifted from rote learning to knowledge-oriented-tech based education system that works for the holistic growth and development of students. Here at SRMIST, we go the extra mile to empower our students to flourish and accomplish their goals with the aid of the latest technologies, modern trends in the teaching learning process and global connectivity. – Dr. P. Ravi, Pro-Chancellor (Administration)
Biography

Dr. P. Ravi is the Pro-Chancellor (Administration) of SRMIST, Kattankulathur, the Chancellor of SRM, Sonipet and does play a major role in deriving strategic growth patterns for all the institutions of the SRM conglomerate.

Dr. Ravi is compassionate in nature and has gone ahead to initiate several scholarships for meritorious as well as economically challenged students so as to enable them to progress in life. He was one of the first to contribute to the State’s Chief Minister’s Relief Fund to support people affected by cyclone ‘Thane’ in Tamil Nadu.  Under his dynamic Chairmanship, SRMIST provided full scholarship (tuition fees and hostel fees waiver) to the students who hailed from localities in and around the cyclone-affected areas particularly agricultural families that were also affected by the cyclone. These scholarships are valid until the students complete their entire program.

Dr. Ravi was also instrumental in establishing the SRM Medical College Hospital and Research Centre at Kattankulathur. In addition to this, he established the SRM Institute of Medical Science (SIMS) at Vadapalani, Chennai. He ensures that the hospitals are updated with the state-of-the-art medical equipment and quality services are rendered with compassion.
His passion for the Hospitality Industry has enabled the SRM Group to establish four hotels of various categories in Tamil Nadu.
In recognition and appreciation for his contribution in the fields of Education, Hospitality and Medical Services, Dr. Ravi was conferred with many awards.
To name a few:

“Lifetime Achievement Award” in Medicine by the World Tamil Organization (UK) and its partner organizations

content.text: Interdisciplinary Institute of Indian System of Medicine (IIISM)

items: Home

Research Wings
Interdisciplinary Institute of Indian System of Medicine (IIISM)

content.text: Overview

Interdisciplinary Institute of Indian System of Medicine (IIISM) is a prestigious school of SRM Institute of Science and Technology which was established in 2008 to promote research in the field of traditional system of Indian Medicine, including Siddha, Ayurveda and Unani.

IIISM is functioning in joint collaboration with Banaras Hindu University in the development of herbal based Siddha, Ayurveda and Unani medicine. It has also signed MoU with AYUSH and Central Council for Research in Ayurveda and Siddha (CCRAS) for promoting research in Siddha, Ayurveda and Unani system of medicine. Further, 200 acres of land has been allocated specifically for the purpose of micro propagation of medicinal plants, reiterating SRMIST’s commitment in establishing a world-class research facility to validate and standardize herbal based medicinal products. Also one acre of land at the University campus has been allocated to establish AYUSH Research Centre with the financial support of the ministry of AYUSH.
Dr. R. C. Satish Kumar
E-mail: dean.iiism@srmist.edu.in
Welcome to IIISM

Our warm welcome to SRMIST’s prestigious Interdisciplinary Institute of Indian System of Medicine (IIISM). It was established in 2008 to promote research in the field of traditional system of Indian Medicine, including Siddha, Ayurveda and Unani. The encouragement and vision of our Founder & Chancellor Dr. T R Paarivendhar is a guiding force for us. IIISM is functioning in joint collaboration with Banaras Hindu University in the development of herbal based Siddha, Ayurveda and Unani medicine. We have ongoing MoUs with AYUSH & CCRAS. This is a great platform for our students, researchers and faculty members to work together on trendsetting research and experiments.

items: Home

Selective Excellence Research Initiative (SERI)

content.text: Selective Excellence Research Initiative

Applications are invited from faculty members of all faculties (E&T, S&H, Management, Medical, Law, Agriculture, and Health Sciences) either individually or in groups for research proposals under the Selective Excellence Research Initiative (SERI) of the SRM Institute of Science and Technology for 2024-2025.

Applications must be written in a simple and easy-to-understand manner without using jargon. Successful proposals may be funded up to a maximum of Rs.5 Lakh for two years. The proposal will be evaluated by a committee chaired by the Dean of Research.
Priority will be given to interdisciplinary and multidisciplinary research areas in collaboration with faculty members from other departments and schools.

The last date for applications is on or before June 30, 2024. Applications must be sent via email to dean.research@srmist.edu.in. Kindly note to address the subject of the mail as “Selective Excellence Research Initiative (SERI-2024) proposal.”
For faculty members

items: To successfully pilot run their research ideas and come out with proof-of-concept
To lead them to get external funds

content.text: Selection Criteria
Related to mission of the University

Priority to faculty with no external / internal funding

High Performance Computing Center
(HPCC)

items: Home
Research
HPCC

content.text: Overview

A High-Performance Computing Center is a location with a  High-performance Computers (HPC) facility usually needed for research work. A high-performance computer (HPC) is a computer with a high-level computational capacity compared to a general-purpose computer. The performance of High-performance computers (HPC) is measured in floating-point operations per second (FLOPS) instead of million instructions per second (MIPS). In general thousands of dedicated processors are placed in proximity to each other (e.g. in a computer cluster); this saves considerable time moving data around and makes it possible for the processors to work together (rather than on separate tasks), for example in mesh and hypercube architectures. High-performance computers (HPC) are typically used for scientific and engineering applications that must handle very large databases or do a great amount of computation (or both).

items: Computational Materials Science
Computational Chemistry
Big-Data Analysis and Data Science
Genetic Engineering
Atmospheric Science
Computational Mechanics and Fluid Dynamics

items: Home
Life at SRM
Complaints & Redressal
Women’s Grievance Redressal Committee

content.text: SRMIST established a Women’s Grievance Cell to address any grievances of the female students, staff, and faculty. We are committed to provide a fully confidential and supportive environment to all the female members of our campus community.
The mandate of this Cell at the institute is to address:
✓ The facilities and needs of the women faculty, staff and students
✓ Problems arising out of any gender-related discrimination

To this end, SRMIST organizes awareness camps, meetings, and seminars while promoting the work of this cell to allow recognition of the rights of women. This right to equality has been provided by the Constitution of India that includes the right to equality before the law, the prohibition of any kind of discrimination related to gender as well as providing equal opportunities in the academic field and their careers.

3rd International Conference on Recent and Advanced Composite Materials

content.text: ICRACM-2025
About the Conference
The conference is being organized with the objectives of:

• Bringing together academicians and industry personnel from all over the world to deliberate upon the challenges opportunities on composites and advanced materials.• Promoting scientific information exchange among the academicians, researchers, developers, engineers, students, and practitioners working around the world.
The conference will cover various aspects of composites and other advanced materials, in the following six tracks

items: Renewable and sustainable composites
Composites for mobility solutions
Energy materials
Biomedical composites
Smart and Advanced Manufacturing of Composites
Informatics for Composites and Advanced Materials

Objectives of the Centre

To become a globally recognized center for stimulating innovative research, development, education, and leadership in the interdisciplinary field of composites and advanced materials to the students and for imparting professional and human values for the upliftment of the society.
To promote interdisciplinary research in the field of composite and advanced materials in collaboration with national and international research groups.
To provide education and training on diverse fields of material engineering to the students, academic and industry personnel.
To create world class design, manufacturing and testing facilities to meet the requirements of the stake holders and to strengthen the interaction with industry.

content.text: Dr. T. R. Paarivendhar Founder Chancellor

Dr. T. R. Paarivendhar founded SRM Group in 1968 and is respected as a Visionary for his service to the cause of Education and Public at large. He served as a Distinguished Parliamentarian representing Perambalur Lok Sabha constituency, Tamil Nadu.

SRM is one of India’s most multicultural large institutions offering a truly multidisciplinary learning experience to students and researchers. It is his foresight and intent to empower through education that he nurtured SRM Institute of Science and Technology into an Institute of Higher Learning with high set of standards for professional education from as early as 1985 (since its inception).

He visualizes God in the smiles of the disenfranchised and neglected and is seeing to it that they are empowered with full scholarships. This is instrumental in developing their life standards and dignity. He is notably supportive of enabling empowerment through education to the meritorious students in Tamil Nadu.

content.text: Highlights

The Nature Index 2023 survey placed SRM Institute of Science and Technology 2nd among the Private Universities and 28th overall in India for its institutional outputs from 1st March 2022 – 28th February 2023 in recognition of the efforts in publishing quality research works in Nature-Indexed Journals.
SRMIST secured 3rd position in UI Green Metric Ranking in 2022 and maintaining 3rd places for the past 3 years, we have a dedicated Green Initiatives and Environmental Sustainable Development CELL.

27 Scientists with SRMIST affiliation were identified among the Top 2% most cited Scientists in their research fields in year 2022, as per survey undertaken by Elsevier BV (Elsevier-Stanford University initiative)

3 Papers have been published the prestigious journal, The Lancet(Impact factor =202.73) with authors from SRMIST apart from research articles published in Nature, Nature Electronics and Nature Communications, etc.

SRMIST secured DST-PURSE project for the proposal entitled “Establishment of Holistic Electric Mobility Infrastructure and Supporting Networks to Promote Research and Start-ups towards National Electric Mobility” supported with  13. 63 crores.

Ministry of Health & Family welfare approved for “conducting National family Health survey – round 6   for the state Tamil Nadu (North and Puducherry)-Phase I”, Sanctioned amount Rs. 7.50 crore (Jan 23)
Recently, three major projects with a total outlay ~ Rs. 5 crores received from BIRAC,-DBT, ICMR and FIST –DST that are related with Covid-19 clinical trials and infrastructure development fund

Boots trappers Research Council (BRC) that governs the entrepreneurial activities of SRM Innovation Incubation and Entrepreneurship Centre (SIIEC) has been selected by the Start-up India Seed Fund Scheme (SISFS) and sanctioned amount Rs. 3 crore (Feb 23)

“Qualitative and Quantitative Assessment of Marine Litter and Micro plastics in the Coastal Environment including Lagoons and Estuarine System along Indian Coast” funded by National Centre for Coastal Research and sanctioned amount Rs. 1.73 crores (Aug 2022)

2 Papers have been published the prestigious journal, The Lancet (Impact factor =79.32) with authors from SRMIST apart from research articles published in Nature, Nature Electronics and Nature Communications, etc.

research.title: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Drug Discovery and Pharmaceutical Research - SRMIST

content.text: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Drug Discovery and Pharmaceutical Research

items: Home
International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Drug Discovery and Pharmaceutical Research

content.text: he International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Drug Discovery and Pharmaceutical Research (AICON 25) commenced with a grand inaugural function at SRM College of Pharmacy, SRM Institute of Science and Technology (SRMIST), Kattankulathur. The event was organised in association with the Indian Pharmaceutical Association (IPA) and Indian Drug Manufacturers Association (IDMA), which had set the stage for an insightful exploration of AI-driven innovations in Pharmaceuticals.

Dr. V. Chitra, Dean of SRM College of Pharmacy, delivered a warm welcome address at the AICON 25 inaugural function, emphasising AI’s transformative role in pharmaceutical research. She highlighted SRM’s commitment to innovation, collaboration, and advancing AI-driven drug discovery for global healthcare solutions.

The Chief Guest, Thiru. M. N. Sridhar, Director of the Drug Control Administration (DCA), Tamil Nadu, delivered an inspiring address on the evolving regulatory landscape and the role of AI in ensuring the safety and efficacy of new drug developments.

The Guest of Honour, Thiru. J. Jayaseelan, Chairman—IDMA and Vice President—IPA, highlighted the importance of integrating AI into pharmaceutical research to accelerate drug discovery and optimise manufacturing processes.

Prof. C. Muthamizhchelvan, Vice Chancellor of SRMIST, presided over the function, emphasising the university’s commitment to advancing interdisciplinary research in AI and healthcare. The felicitation address was provided by Lt. Col. (Dr) A. Ravi Kumar, Advisor (MHS), SRMIST and Dr. K. S. Lakshmi, Director, Admission, SRMIST, who underscored the significance of AI-powered solutions in modern medicine. Dr. Makarand Avachat, Executive Vice President, Pharma R&D, Lupin Limited, Pune, delivered the keynote address on the role of AI in drug design and development. A major highlight of the event was the release of the Souvenir and the Pharma Pearls Newsletter, showcasing cutting-edge research and contributions in Pharmaceutical Sciences by SRM College of Pharmacy.
The function concluded with a vote of thanks by Dr. N. Damodharan, Vice Principal of SRM College of Pharmacy, followed by the National Anthem, marking the successful commencement of AICON 25.

With an overwhelming response from academia, industry, and research professionals of 450 delegates in and around the country. The conference boasts the presence of 13 International and National speakers from all around the world. The inaugural session set the tone for an engaging and impactful conference, fostering collaborations and discussions on AI’s transformative role in pharmaceuticals.
Where could your journey at university take you?
